Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [entering office] Hey. So, we saw a new billboard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah? Pretty cool, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What better way to announce our new slightly lower prices than with an ad campaign? And what better face for an ad campaign than our new regional manager?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How'd it look?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You've seen it, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Andy, somebody defaced it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? [Stanley enters office laughing] Morning, Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's this thing that people tend to do with billboards. How do I put this? If there's an opportunity for a graffiti artist to work in a... phallic shape, interacting with the artwork, it'll happen, and Andy gave them that opportunity.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin, how long did we order those billboards for?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Six months.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, god. I need you to call the billboard company.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [entering office] Great billboard! Funny, edgy, right up to the line without crossing it, loved it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Which one did you see?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Washington Street, the one with, like, twenty dongs on it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, don't be gross.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [entering office] What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Somebody defaced the billboards we just put out in an inappropriate way.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, that's funny. Wait, from the photo shoot with you and me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. No. No! NO! NO! NO! NO! NO! [running from building] No, no, no, no, no, no, No, No, No, NO, NO! NO! NO! NO! [stopping in front of defaced billboard] NOOOOOOOOO!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Schrute Farms is very easy to find, it's right in the middle of the root vegetable district. If the soil starts to get acidic, you've probably gone too far.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Just give us the address. We'll look it up online.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's simpler this way.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's really not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now, stated arrival time is 3 p.m.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't get the reason for this party.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, what's the reason?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What's the reason, Andy? What's the reason?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's just a garden party. Sheesh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You don't need a reason to throw a garden party anymore than you need a reason to throw a birthday party. It's a garden party. You don't need a reason.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Few other super simple reminders - no burping, no slurping, when eating take small bites and chew thoroughly with your mouth closed. Yes, Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What happens when we're done chewing? Do we spit it out on the floor, or keep it in our mouths the rest of the time?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I get it, I'm being a little overbearing. But I promise to be underbearing for a week if you guys just all... step it up.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy, we understand basic table manners, we're not children.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's just a picnic.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is not a picnic, Phyllis, it's a garden party.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: There's a grill in the warehouse I could bring.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aw, ew, please don't. Not a barbecue. It's better than a barbecue. It's dignified, quieter, there are rules.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How is that better than a barbecue?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's the dress code on this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm glad you asked - Connecticut Casual.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Any chance Connecticut Casual is Pennsylvania Business, i.e. this is what I'm wearing to your party.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys, my family just threw a garden party to celebrate my brother's promotion. It was a huge success. Check it out, there's a video online. Heartwarming impromptu father-son duet.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, Oscar, you showed me this.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I've seen this, that's not you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, whoa, who's the sausage?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's my dad and my brother. I would have joined in but this melody doesn't really support another harmony part, so... Check it out, that's my brother's boss. Look how psyched he is, he's having an awesome time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, and did Robert California get an invite to your party?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, of course. Ye... I mean, uh, yeah, I think he did. [groans from the group]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Why didn't you just say this was to impress Robert California?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I cannot believe that Andy is throwing a party like this just to impress the CEO. Classic Gabe move. Hey Andy, how about you don't steal my business strategies, and I won't dress like my life is just one long brunch?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: See you all there at 3 p.m., Connecticut Casual, remember your manners, and have a wonderful time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And please refer to the map, stay off of the web. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [pointing to computer monitor] So, we've typed in the address, now let's take a look at the street view. [picture of Dwight and Mose on a see-saw]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They don't warn you when the cameras are driving by.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah. Why do you keep reading that garden party book? I mean, how hard are finger sandwiches and tea?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's so much more to it than that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've been wanting Schrute Farms to break into the high-end event hosting industry for some time, and this party is a great opportunity. Plus, I've got a secret weapon. [holds up book, Throwing A Garden Party by James Trickington] Only one copy in the world and some sucker on the internet sold it to me for two dollars. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm actually really disappointed in how poorly my book is doing. [holds up same book] I've only sold one copy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is there anything you wish you had done differently to avoid cankles?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I've already gone up another cup size. The senator is grossed out. When do you start feeling it kick?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cece was around 22 weeks, but Phillip was much earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phillip?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, oh my gosh. Yes, but don't, don't say anything, okay? It's after my grandfather.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phillip is the name that we're using. It's after my favorite cat.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [giggling] Oh, wow. Funny. It's after my grandfather.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's after my cat.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Andrew, I've picked up two possible gifts to bring this afternoon. One, a pot of marmalade.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ooh, that sounds great.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well, that, that is what you want then, the marmalade.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You don't want to hear the other one. You love marmalade.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, I'll hear the other one.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's a basil plant.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, the marmalade sounds great.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I also mentioned the marmalade to my sister and she's very interested.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Then the basil will be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well, you clearly want the marmalade. Gretchen, I need another marmalade. Alright. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, where do I park?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: I'm the valet. You have to give me your car.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, you know what, I can go park it myself.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: I'm the... I'm the valet. You have to give me your car.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's probably okay...

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Give me your car.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I think it's better that I...

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Give me your car.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's a finicky car...

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Get out. Have a good time at the thing.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's a little tricky, you might have to... take... [Mose speeds away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: MR. RYAN HOWARD!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Chapter 2 - Announcing guests as they enter is the height of decorum. The more volume displayed, the more honor is bestowed upon everyone present.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: STANLEY HUDSON AND HIS MISTRESS CYNTHIA! JAMES, PAMELA, AND PEEPEE HALPERT!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How's it going over here, guys?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy, stop hovering, you're being really annoying.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Didn't mean to bother you, Mabel. Mabel, Mabel, if you're able, keep your elbows off the table.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: MR. AND MRS. WALTER AND ELLEN BERNARD!

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: So, you all work with Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, technically FOR Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Technically FOR Robert California. He's our CEO.

Quote.Speaker: Ellen
Quote.Text: I thought you were the CEO.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know how you got there.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: You said you were running the company.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This branch, I'm the regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Yes, that makes more sense. Are you all regional managers?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did I throw this party to impress my parents? That's crazy. Now, if they wanted a garden party, they could throw one themselves, which, as a matter of fact, they did, last week. They threw one for my baby brother who is totally amazing, but I couldn't care less.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can I introduce you around now?

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah, we don't have too long, we have theater tickets.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you going to see?

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Money Ball. Walter Jr.'s choice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What??

Quote.Speaker: Walter Jr
Quote.Text: Hey Bronard!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't know you were going to be here.

Quote.Speaker: Walter Jr
Quote.Text: I wouldn't have missed it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ahh! [bird steals her hat]

Quote.Speaker: Walter Jr
Quote.Text: I'm Walter, Andy's younger brother.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, how are you doing, I'm Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Walter Jr
Quote.Text: Tuna, right? And this must be your lovely wife Pam [looking at Meredith].

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hell no. She wishes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. No.

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Sir, I need to be able to feed all the guests.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [mouthful of food] I understand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Set that down. [grabs waitress] Present yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Chapter 4 - One of the host's most important duties is as Dance Master. A proper courtly dance sets the tone for the entire afternoon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: LADIES AND GENTLEMEN, MAY I PRESENT, ROBERT CALIFORNIA!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hello Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, I want you to meet my first bosses, Mom and Dad.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yes, hello, nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, where shall I put your basil plant?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I thought you were going to bring marmalade.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No, I'm certain you said basil.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is not funny, man, let me down.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think this thing is broken.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's not broken, Kevin. This is how it works.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So pretty today.

Quote.Speaker: Ellen
Quote.Text: It's getting chilly.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: We really should be leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, um, it would be weird if the boss man didn't make a toast, so, hang on. Everybody, I just want to take this opportunity to thank you all for coming, and to raise a glass to my amazing staff.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Toasts are great. I mean, you toast somebody, they toast you back. It just goes round and round. That's my favorite part about toasts, the reciprocity.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's hear from you guys, who do you want to toast?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'll say something. I think we should be acknowledging our boss, because none of us would be here without him. Robert California! [everyone toasts]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I can't believe I didn't think of toasting Robert. Get in the game, Gabriel! Why are you talking to Stanley's mistress?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I would like to toast someone who isn't here but who will be in just four short months. Welcome to the world, Phillip Lipton!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I also would like to toast Phillip Halpert, who is due even sooner. May he be a good namesake to my grandfather who I promised as a child long before tonight that I would one day name my son after him. To Phillip Halpert!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: She just always has to copy anything I do! It's the Ford Taurus situation all over again!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'd like to make a toast to the troops. All the troops. Both sides.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I think we should toast...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen! The last supper.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Chapter 9 - The tableau vivant is not only welcomed, but expected entertainment at any garden party.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Andy? I think we should acknowledge the man who has led us to such a profitable quarter. To Robert California.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I would also like to toast Robert California. Mr. California,...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You can't triple toast somebody! At least not until we get everyone once.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I'll say a few words if that's alright with you, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You people say I led you, but it wasn't me. You want to toast the man who led you to success, but the boss is irrelevant. Andy and I, we produce nothing. We do nothing. We sit in our offices and demand, I want this and that right now, like petulant children. You know, the difference between a crying baby and a manager, one day the baby will grow up. But, without you, Andy and I would be sitting in our dirty diapers, waiting for someone to change us, wipe us. I should be toasting you, thanking you, for allowing me to have the easiest job in the universe. Cheers.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: To Robert California, from the moment you entered our building and our hearts, you...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Some of you know that we have an internet star in our midst. Mr. Walter Baynes Bernard Sr., please report to the stage!

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: I'm eating, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: What do you want to do?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, how about one of our classic father/son duets? [starts playing guitar]

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Oh, whoa, sure? Really? It's a little tricky.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] Saying I love you is not the words...

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: It's too high.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: It's high but it's not that high.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right, it feels strange.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Just take it down a little.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Saying I love... Saying I love you...

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Here, give it to me. Okay. Uh, something like... [singing] Saying I love you is...

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Walter
Quote.Text: ...not the words...

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: You don't come in yet. [singing] ...I want to hear from you, It's not that I want you...

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Walter
Quote.Text: ...not to say it but if you only knew... More than words is all you have to do to make it real...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is anyone filming this? Seriously! Erin!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [holding up cell phone] It's either taping or calling.

Quote.Speaker: Andy & Walter
Quote.Text: What would you do if my heart was torn in two...

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: You know what, Walter Jr. is here. Why don't you come up and join us?

Quote.Speaker: Walter Jr
Quote.Text: Dad, no. I'm just having a good time getting to know Andy's friends here.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Get up there and sing or I will cut your larynx and you'll never be able to sing again. Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Walter & Walter Jr
Quote.Text: [singing] May the good lord be with you down every road you roam. And may sunshine and happiness surround you when you're far from home. And may you grow to be proud, dignified and true. And do unto others as you'd have done to you...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [applauds] Cheers! Alright! Cheers, cheers, cheers, get your own guitar.

Quote.Speaker: Erin's Cell Phone
Quote.Text: If you'd like to make a call, please hang up and try again.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I am so cold.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's because you didn't bring a jacket.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My first love is beet farming, but it's a young man's game. Who ever heard of an old beet farmer?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Forget the beets. Concentrate on the hosting. I could spend a considerable amount of money having my birthday party here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh really? Well, we have a number of birthday packages. The Pewter Package has the least amount of goats, not no goats, it's still 10-12 goats, depending on the availability of the goats. Now the Goat Package obviously has the most goats. What were you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Of course I am not interested in goats. Why would you spend so much time going over the goats with me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can get you exotic meats - hippo steaks, giraffe burgers...

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: We'll talk. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It'll all be goat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello, Cece Halpert? This is Andrew Bernard. I'd very much like to speak with you about your paper supply needs. That wasn't even my worst sales call.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: [knocks] Hi. What was that display?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know, I just thought if I could throw this great garden party and show you how respected I am that you'd be proud of me.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: Andrew...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know, I know that you're proud of me.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: I'm not going to tell you how impressed I am that you're a manager of some rinky dink branch of a paper company in Scranton, Pennsylvania. How long are you going to go on needing my approval? You're a grown man, don't act like a little boy who needs...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I think if I had parents like that I'd be trying to convince everyone all the time how great I was, too.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Guess we found Andy's rosebud.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Rosebud?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's a reference to Citizen Kane. Something that explains why a person became the way they are.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I know Citizen Kane. Rosebud didn't explain why he was how he was, it just represented what was important to him as a child, that he missed.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Different school of thought. Let's just agree to disagree.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No. You're wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah! I'm too hot anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: My body has somehow become acclimated to southern Italy. Isn't that strange? I've never been there! Oh, ah, yes, that's nice. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Walter
Quote.Text: It was a nice party, the setting was a little strange. Uh, the food...

Quote.Speaker: Ellen
Quote.Text: Sandwiches were dry.

Quote.Speaker: Walter Jr
Quote.Text: Bye Tuna, bye Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey everybody, I'm gonna leave and I just wanted to say I'm really sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Cheeseburger or hamburger.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, cheeseburger.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Narddog. [throws Andy a can]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are they doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Closing ceremonies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice touch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think I left my wallet in your house.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who cares.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: MR. JAMES HALPERT!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Keys, keys...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop forgetting things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I didn't forget them, they're right here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: MR. JAMES HALPERT!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry, I think I forgot that thing...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: MIS... MI... What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, I have a question. Who do you think is really the best salesman in this office?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's a stupid question, obviously mISTER JAMES HALPERT!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I cannot believe how condescending Andy's being.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: He gets condescending when he's nervous. Or when he's excited or sleepy. Not an easy person to be friends with.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Well I just hate being treated like some bum with no class. I'm a lady. I'm a mother. I'm a former boxer!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey guys, getting psyched for the party? Ryan? Can I count on you to wear an understated satirical outfit?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Can't wait. A folk colonialist gathering when unemployment's at 9%. I wouldn't miss it for the world.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Erin....the receptionist!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, oh, Kevin. I am reminded of a lame but useful saying I learned as a kid. What is the difference between Hors d'oeuvres and the animals on Noah's ark?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: With Hors d'oeuvres we only take one at a time.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, OK. What's the difference between a vacuum cleaner and a blonde?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Chapter seven: The host should always present something spectacular to draw the eye of his guests.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When all this is over, I'd like to actually go to one of Trickington's parties, they sound like a blast.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ladies and Gentlemen! I present to you...the Alamo! [reveals lump of ice]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Little Cici asleep?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, she just went down.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Such a precious little angel.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aww.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Cecilia....and Phillip.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, after my grandfather.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phillip is wasted on you. Jim is never gonna take the time to call him Phillip! He doesn't even take the time to get a haircut. And Phil! Ugh! It's just something you do to a hole!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well I'm having my baby first, so that's that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You know what? It could go either way. My doctor said my hips are so dainty that I'll most definitely have a C-section, so I could go early.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You think your doctor's going to give you a C-section at six months?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah! If I request it he will. And that is that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My parents are used to a certain type of class. The people that I work with are a different type of class. One is not better than the other, it's just that maybe one's a little higher than the other?
